description:
Cards have descriptions on one side, objects on the other. Leave 2 more objects than the number of players in the middle of the table.

One player is the judge. They turn their back, then read out three descriptions. Everyone quickly grabs a card, and puts them into a pile near the judge.

The judge now turns around, and makes a decision as to which object best first the 3 descriptions.

You can also play without the judge turning around, and take turns presenting arguments to the judge after the grabbing.

Either way, one person gets a point and the judge rotates.

Play until everyone has been the judge once.

-description from designer

A wealthy alien has promised you riches beyond your wildest dreams if you can collect five of the items on their shopping list. There's only one issue: the wares of the market are only marked with Orpian symbols! You only know one symbol and must deduce the other players' tidbits of alien symbology to be the first to fulfill your wealthy client's request and profit from the intergalactic bazaar of Orp.

Instead of traditional hidden roles, every player knows the translation of one Orpian symbol. Players take turns asking each-other questions about their symbols or their meaning. They may also additionally ask a second question, swap cards with another player, or draw locked container cards from the deck. Once a player believes they have won, they will declare victory and then secretly check the results. If they have not won, they are eliminated from the game and play continues, so one must be fairly certain of victory before declaring it.

This game is a must-have for lovers of matrix logic puzzles, alien linguistics, trading, and social deduction.

-description from designer

Wander: LaCluck's Revenge is the second game in the Wander series. A fully cooperative, campaign-driven, miniatures board game. The Cult of Barnacle Bay was meddling with magic far beyond their understanding and accidentally resurrected the Ghost Pirate Chicken Lord LaCluck and her mutinous crew of Ghost Pirate Monkey Grunts, Ghastly Pig Gunners, Wailing Albatross Banshees, and Rampaging Rhino Cannoneers!

In Wander: LaCluck's Revenge, players will select one of five unique heroes from the Wanderer's Guild and join their friends to fight back against these ghost pirate phantoms to save the poor town of Barnacle Bay. Defeating foes and surviving random encounters earns players experience points and loot. Loot, like weapons and armor, is a persistent upgrade, staying with the heroes as they continue on their adventure. Experience points are used to level up heroes during their current adventure in the campaign. A dual-facing upgrade tree allows players to continually try new combinations of skills each adventure to determine what fits their play style, or current set of foes, best.

Using a modular tiles, players assemble maps as indicated in the choose your own adventure campaign book, then use action points to move or attack with their hero.

All enemies in the game are controlled by a simple line of sight A.I., and automatically hit the players' heroes once they're able to. This means there is no player rolling for success for enemies' attacks. Heroes will, however, be able to roll for defense in an effort to prevent incoming wounds. One set of custom dice determines a hero's success for both defending and attacking. Random encounter cards, which are revealed when players enter an unexplored "darkness" space, also promise that no campaign adventure is ever be the same.

-description from designer

Minikin Saga: Jewels is a competitive micro game for 2 to 3 players. Where players as thieves stole a gem from a masquerade and must escape undetected, by revealing the opponents' identities and use them as scapegoat before they discover theirs.
At the beginning of the game, players will draw 2 Pawns from a bag, the combinations of those pawn's colors will determine is your identity.

On your turn you must do 1 Action from the 3 possible:
-Interrogate: Move a card (You can flip it too) to another empty space and ask a question. This question must refer to what the opponent's character can see. ex. Your Suspect see a Bird? Your Suspect can't see the color, Yellow? This is going to give you information about their identity.

-Investigate: At random and without looking inside the bag, take a pawn and look at it in secret. This will reveal what color is not in play and its not part of someone’s identity.

-Accuse: Point to an opponent (The other player closes their eyes in a 3 Player Game) and point to a card, if you discover the opponent's identity you win the game (In a 3 Player Game you must discover the other player's identity too) If not you lose that action and you must reveal one of your pawns to the accused player.

The game ends when a player discovers all the opponents' identities, that player is the winner!

-description from designer

Awards & Recognitions:
13th Roll & Write Game Design Contest

     1st Best Overall Game
     1st Best Solitaire Game
     1st Best Thematic Game
     1st Best Video Gameplay
     1st Best Game Sheet
     2nd Best Innovative Mechanic 
     3rd Best Cover


You just moved to the province to live a simple life. You promised yourself you’ll get things done in 10 days. Plant crops, make friends, mine the mountains, populate your pond and donate to the museum to achieve your goals.

A simple life is a 1-2 player roll & write game inspired by relaxing pixel art farming video games such as Stardew Valley and Harvest Moon.

Game Summary
The game is played in 10 rounds. Each round you roll 5 dice. Use the dice on locations on the sheet and perform the location’s action. When you run out of dice the round ends and a new round is started. If you completed your goal at the end of the game, count your score.

—description from the designer

Art Credits: 
Shikashi's Fantasy Icon Pack * Overworld Grass Biome * Pixel Paper * DungeonUI * Fantasy Eggs * Midjourney

This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Quarterly, Agneta Hellwig invites to an opulent dinner at home. 7 selected guests are looking forward to a glamorous performance in front of an impressive backdrop. Theme of the evening: 'Cleopatra's last aria'.

But the closed society has to watch in horror as the hostess collapses at her own event. In the hospital, it quickly becomes clear: Agneta has been poisoned and barely escaped with her life.
But who wanted to poison the lovely old lady in her own home and why? All guests and employees are stunned because it must have been one of them.

The Bremerburgen police are overloaded and need your help. Take on the file and solve the case before Ms. Hellwig becomes the victim of another attack.

"A party game for horrible German families"

Play begins with a judge, known as the "Round Boss", choosing a red fill-in-the-blank card from the top of the deck and showing it to all players. Each player holds a hand of eight white answer cards at the beginning of each round, and passes a card (sometimes more) to the round boss, face-down, representing their answer to the question on the card. The round boss determines which answer card(s) are funniest in the context of the fill-in-the-blank card. The player who submitted the chosen card(s) is given the question card to represent a point, and then the player to the left of the Round Boss becomes the new Boss for the next round. Play continues until the players agree to stop, or until they are thrown out of the pub, at which point the player with the most Points is the winner.

Kampf gegen das Spießertum – Family Edition is the family friendly version of Kampf gegen das Spiessertum. It contains 600 new cards. All the answer cards are illustrated.

You awake, disoriented, foggy. You are alone…silence. You shamble through shadowy corridors webbed with mycelium growths slithering towards you. Opaque blackened clouds of haunting fog loom in a cramped tunnel teeming with unnatural fungal forms beckoning you to come closer. Ghostly black figures dart through the effluvium spurring paranoid thoughts as your inner voice asks “is someone there or am I losing my mind?” You begin to feel weak, your psyche slips, your dread mounts. Your survival instinct suddenly kicks in and you realize that if you're here much longer, you may never leave. Can you escape the Black Mold?

In Black Mold you are an escaped prisoner trying to find your way out of an abandoned subterranean prison compound. Black undulating fungal growths coat every surface of these corridors, emitting ghostly clouds that poison the air. To avoid breathing the harmful, hallucinogenic mist, you must limit your exposure and make your escape. This is simulated in the game by limiting the length of your turn to how long you're able to physically hold your breath.

A tense, "co-op till it's not" survival horror escape with 70 areas to reveal and survive, numerous items to find and craft, 6 unique prisoners to play and multiple win conditions every harrowing escape is different than the last. 


—description from the designer

Woodwalkers: The Game is a board game that allows two to four players to compete with multiple animal characters in two levels. In the role of "shapeshifter students" the players learn everything they need to know about their lives as humans and animals. In the subject "Combat and Survival" exiting team battles are on the schedule, in which they have to prove their skills to finally triumph over the others.

In each round the start player chooses one of three battle mode tiles, which describes the category of duels in this round like endurance, speed, intelligence or strength. Once each player has rolled a dice (maximum number of spaces animal tiles can move on the board), moved and possibly carried out an action such as turning over a forest tile or dueling another player, a players turn ends and the next player left of the start player continues by choosing again one of three battle mode tiles.

If there are fewer than three battle mode tiles left the game ends and players getting scores for each animal tiles which are on a space with a flag. The player with the most points wins the game.

On the legendary island of Dei, advanced technologies have allowed the creation of an artificial paradise.
Through genetic engineering, Humans have reached immortality.
Now self-proclaimed deities, they manipulate Nature to provide for their needs, and entertainment.
Here, Versus is the national sport. Inspired by gladiatorial combat, the Versus Games are held in the Arena.
The fighters are named Aeons. They are powerful bio-synthetic creatures, conceived with the sole purpose of killing.

In this card game of strategy, players take one the role of Humans, capable of summoning Aeons in the Arena.
To win the game, you must eliminate all of your opponent's cards.

All cards are unique, balanced, independent, and versatile. If you consistently find better synergies than your opponent, you'll win.
Versus is easy to learn (10min), and quick to get started (1min). No deck building needed. Baffling simplicity, frightening depth.
Adjust the game duration (from 10 to 40min), and the level of complexity. Make it chill, or epic.

Play 1v1, or up to 6v6. Yes, you can form 2 teams of up to 6 players each, everyone playing on the same board !

—description from the designer

You have to find and rescue endangered animals scattered here and there. Check where the animals are, add their numbers, and make 10 — then you can bring them to a safe place! The first to rescue ten animals wins!

Memory Island is a memory/arithmetic game for 2-4 players. Make the sum of the numbers equal to 10, and be the first player to collect ten cards to win.

You make someone age by playing cards on your turn. Make yourself age slower, others faster! Sometimes special cards may show up and turn things around, so be careful!

Cradle to Grave is a party card game for 2-5 players that penalizes other players by raising their age.

Summary:
- Trigahex is a strategic abstract card game for 2-6 players.
- Play individually or in a team.
- Suitable for ages 8+.
- Players can choose the length of play by deciding how many Hexagons win the game (1, 2 or 3). Approximately 10 minutes - 40 minutes.

The Playing Cards:
Trigahex includes three Triangle coloured decks of cards (54 x Red, 54 x Blue and 54 x Green).
Each player or team chooses a colour to play with.

The Object of the Game:
The first person or team to create the winning number of Hexagons wins the game.

Win a Hexagon by placing 6 of your cards together to create a Hexagon shape.  All the cards in the Hexagon MUST have your chosen playing card colour in the centre of the card.

Before you play:
Decide how many Hexagons to play to win the game (1, 2, or 3).

The first player places a card in the game area,  Players then take turns to place a card adjacent to the card/s placed.  The colours on the edges of the cards MUST match the edges of the cards they are placed next to.

Try to create your own Hexagon/s or stop your opponent from creating their Hexagon/s.

If a player places a card that has a White Triangle in the middle, they also pick up an action card.

The 'Trash' action card:
A player trashes a card from the game area and it is returned to the bottom of the draw stack.

The 'Replace' action card:
A player replaces a card from the game area with a card in their hand.  The edges of the card must match any cards in the game area.  The replaced card is returned to the the bottom of the draw stack.

The 'Stack' action card:
A player stacks a card from their hand on top of a card in the game area.  The edges of the card must match the edges of any cards it is adjacent to.  The card underneath remains and is stuck in the game area.

-description from designer

Roll the die then draw a card and read the corresponding question/direction. Some require the use of the map (e.g. which country borders this country on the east). If you are correct, draw a token, which is worth the number of points shown. 1st P to collect 100 pts in tokens wins.

Dated is a trivia game for people who suck at trivia. The rules are simple. Each round, one player picks a category and reads the title out loud. All other players take turns guessing the year it was released. The closest guess wins the card! The first player to ten cards wins the game.

-description from publisher

In this sweet dessert-themed card bidding game players manage their hand of cards, bid on others' cards, and try to get multiples of the same type of dessert, as well as a high value of coins. On your turn you offer a dessert for others to bid on. The first person to get 6 of a kind, or Sweet Six, ends the game, but may not win, because of the way scoring works.

-description from designer

The board has 4 rows w/10 spaces each representing a player’s lab bench. Each player places their cat standee at the start of their bench then conducts one of 4 classic modern physics experiments by drawing a card for the experiment and resolving it. Most cards move your cat and cats move a different way for each experiment. If you reach the end of a bench, take a party hat. First to get 4 hats wins.

Blackbody Radiation Experiment. Includes die with faces 0/black, 2 red/1, 2 green/2, and 1 blue/3. Roll the dice to see what color photon comes out of the blackbody oven. The rarer the photon, the more your cat advances.

Rutherford Gold Foil Experiment. Includes spinner w/4 spaces: red/1 (takes up half of circumference), 2 gold/2 spaces (each takes up 1/6 of the circumference), and blue/3 (takes up 1/6 of the circumference). Spin the spinner to see in what direction your alpha particle scattered. The rarer the outcome, the farther you can advance.

Double-Slit experiment. Includes 2 dice each w/3 white (0/1/2) and 3 black (0/1/2) faces. Roll both to see if your electron ends up in a region of constructive or destructive interference. If faces are same color (constructive interference), add them. If different, subtract the smaller from the larger.

Photoelectric Effect. Includes 3 dice w/faces: red/1000 Kelvin (move 1 space), green/3000K (move 2 spaces), and blue/200k (move 3 spaces). Roll the dice to see what color lamp your can has chosen. Some colors of light will eject electrons from the metal at higher velocity, meaning your cat can advance further.

Each deck consists of 10 “Run the Experiment” cards (if you draw one, run the experiment as above) plus a number of special cards. If you draw the Wolfgang Pauli card, Pauli shows up to observe and breaks your experiment. “Save this Card” allows you to place a note on the door to direct auli to another room. “Ummm???” – someone measure the momentum of your cat so precisely that its position is uncertain. Roll 1 double-slit die and move forward if you roll white and backward if you roll black. “Rawr!” – you encounter a potential energy barrier and have a 50% chance to quantum tunnel through it (by rolling double-slit die as above). “Yikes!”: your cat ruins the experiment so you don’t move. “Hooray”: your cat did something to help you – move again.

The hit transit card game LOOP now has a standalone expansion! The new LOOP: Renovated Edition contains all new event cards, plus some new wild cards and a full set of station cards. It can be played on its own, or combined with the original edition of LOOP to double the fast-paced, chaotic fun!

Ride the rails of the elevated trains in Chicago’s famous Loop! Match the line colors and stations to make your way around town, but beware the everyday perils of signal delays, broken escalators, and unexplainable smells as you get where you’re going!

Like the original, LOOP: Renovated Edition is a 10-20 minute game suitable for ages 9 and up. One deck can support a game of 2-7 players, but when combined with the original edition of LOOP you can play with up to 14 people!

-description from publisher's website

In Bananine, you will compete to collect banana cards with quantities ranging from 1 to 9.

On your turn, take one stack of banana cards from the banana market and add them to your storeroom. Then choose banana cards from your hand with a total quantity equal to that of the cards you took and place them in the banana market.

Before ending your turn, stack the cards in the banana market by quantity. If a stack’s total quantity is 10 or more, discard that stack.

At the end of the game, score each quantity of banana card separately. The player who has the most banana cards of a given quantity in their storeroom will score points for it.

-description from designer

Escape to the West is an original Czech escape game, which follows the story of Pavel from the 70th year of the last century. Help Paul escape from severe totalitarianism through the Iron Curtain. The story will be accompanied by cards with puzzles, from which you will compile a map that will help you come up with the best way to get to West Germany. Will you be able to escape across a closely watched border?

Once a year, monsters from every corner compete in a showdown to be chosen for the academy and become disciples of the legendary QU'ARZ —the extraterrestrial being who flipped the world upside down. Prove your mob is unique, clever, and worthy of joining his cult of chaos! Are you ready to join the mob, munch on some power, and capture that crystal?

QU'ARZ is a capture-the-flag brawl that’s definitely NOT a kids’ game. Join the yearly tournament where every monster is out to snatch the Crystal Idol and get it back to the camp before time runs out.

Each player commands a trio of uniquely savage monsters, each sporting its own deck of action cards. Mix and match basic moves with your monster’s special flair to outwit and out-munch your foes. Swipe the Crystal Idol from the altar and sprint it back to your camp. Keep an eye on the clock, think fast. One slick move, and you win instantly — everyone else gets left in the dust.

If the clock hits zero without the Crystal Idol finding a home, victory points collected during the game will crown the winner.

-description from designer

In the year 1587 an act was passed for "the quieting and keeping in obedience of the disordeit and subjectis inhabitants of the Borders, Highlands, and Isles."

Along with this, a list of Clans, 13 Clans. 13 of the most notorious of the Border Reivers. In the game, you will play as one of these Clans. Collect Livestock, Crops, Followers, and Soldiers and use them to build your Clan's influence. With them, you will purchase "Holdings," land, Armies, and Strongholds, gaining you victory points. Gain the most victory points and become the most prominant Clan on the border.

As a Clan Chief, you will perform 1 of 2 actions on your turn: Gather Tokens or purchase Holdings. When purchasing Holdings you will also gain sheep for your pasture but beware, a Reiver is at first a theif. You or your neighboring Clans may conduct raids, stealing sheep from one another. Sheep are a valued resource and are worth victory points; a large flock could tilt the victory in your favor. Lastly: Each individual Clan has a unique ability drawn from the annals of history. The Devil's Dozen brings the history, hardships, fueds, and forays of the 16th Century Border life to the game table...

-description from publisher
In WatchMojo: A Super Fan Top 10 Party Game, you submit entries to Top 10 Lists about pop culture subjects to be judged and ranked by the game round's ranker.

These days, dating can be downright scary. Seriously, who wants to get ghosted?

In the light strategy party card game Love Is Dead, players compete to match with Boos in the dating pool by playing trait cards that correspond to the Boo's traits. Will you match with AJ who's only looking for a date to their cousin's funeral? Or Niah, who'll ghost you just for being an Aries? Opponents can play negative cards, like deal-breakers, to sabotage one another.

Once a player matches with three Boos, the game ends, and whoever scores the most points from their matches wins!

A space conglomerate-corporation is building a new Dyson Sphere in an uncharted galaxy. They're looking for a "go-to" crew of mercenaries and pioneers, so they've issued a galaxy-wide challenge... Bring them what they need in a timely manner and you'll be rewarded with a full-time contract(handsome salaries and benefits included).

Build a crew, mod your ship, and race against the other competing crews, to mine resources and battle your way to victory! This is an uncharted galaxy, so anything goes.

The game board is customizable and modular, so gameplay is different every time you play. Before you start the game, players will take turns placing game pieces for the session. You can play however you'd like!

A single mission card, showing which resources and how much of each are required, is drawn for the game session (all players will be racing to complete this). The first player to gather the requested resources and travels back to the space station wins the game. All players (given three random crew members) start at the space station at the beginning of the game, and roll dice to determine how far they can navigate that turn(crew skills can increase this roll).

Once a player has reached a planet or asteroid(each have their own unique resources) they can mine. You can mine a planet once per turn, for a max of two turns. Mining does not end your turn however, so its best to start it by mining every time.

You can also battle other players to steal their resources, eliminate crew members, or destroy any tech mods they may have. This requires you to be on the same spot as the opposing player however. Another way to use your turn is to spend any unneeded resources to upgrade your ship with tech mods or new crew members (max of 4).

Once a player has acquired the necessary resources to complete the mission card, they must navigate back to where they started the game. Once they have arrived, they win the game. Watch out for other players trying to steal your loot though!

-description from designer

Trolls are not big and stupid, as many would have you believe. Not long ago they lived among us and they used their cunning magic to look like us humans.
They lived with their cattle in the mountains. Their caves were beautiful and luxurious with a lot of silver, gold, gems, and a table full of delicious food. In Sweden, there is an expression for this “Rich as a troll”.
Trolls were not evil if you didn’t treat them badly, they could even be helpful to those who treated them well. But they often played tricks on humans. Their magic power (trollkraft) could distort the vision of humans so the troll looked like a human, an animal, a log, and a stone and even become invisible. But they also had some weaknesses. They couldn’t stand the sounds of church bells or steel, not to mention the sight of sun.

Trolls & Princesses is a “worker movement” game. You play as one of four troll clans and to get the mountains king’s favour, you try to impress him. The players get favour (in the form of victory points) when they do what trolls usually do: swap changelings, “hire” humans, tear down church bells, kidnap princesses, build their cave, and use troll magic. To succeed, the players must collect resources and move around their trolls to do different actions. The player with the most victory points at the end can crown himself the ultimate troll clan leader.

—description from publisher

The farm is in chaos! The animals have wandered everywhere.
Now it’s up to you to bring them all back to their own paddocks.

You can play this game in two ways:
COOPERATIVE – make sure the animals get back to their own paddocks. But watch out! All animals must be back before dark or everyone loses!

COMPETITIVE – cross your fellow player(s) by blocking the paddock. Will you be the first to drive your livestock into their own paddocks?

—description from the publisher

Now it's time to enter a magical world of fabulous and terrifying desserts!
You are the cooks hired for a great feast in honor of the hungry Queens with somewhat peculiar tastes. Everything is valid to win the favors of the Queens and stand out in the competition! And as for the others… We can't guarantee they'll manage to keep their heads...

Sirvam a Rainha is the newest trick-taking game in the Sirvam collection!
Each player starts the game with six recipe cards and each round they must vote on which Queen's order to serve, establishing the trick rules of this round. Cards are sweets of different types, qualities and flavors. After the cards are selected, it's time to serve the feast. SERVE THE QUEEN!

The game comes with 5 different queens, each with their own tastes and scoring method. Whether it's the Twin Queens who disagree with their preferred type or the Mathematical Queen that wants the cards in numerical sequence, it's up to players to adapt at the demands and offer the best dishes at the feast.

-description from publisher

The original Escape Crime Game in the practical card box

The daughter of a very rich industrialist was kidnapped - ransom demand: one and a half million euros! The criminal police put YOU on it, their special officer for tricky cases. You set about investigating, but are knocked out from behind at the point where the ransom is handed over. When you wake up, you find yourself chained in the basement of an abandoned office building with no food or the slightest clue as to what is in store for you. Can you break free, track down the missing girl and escape the kidnappers' hideout alive?

The Death Star exhaust port is only two metres wide but the Rebel Fleet must make a direct hit in order to destroy the Death Star! As leader of your fleet, organize your crews, and make your attack runs.

The aim of the game is to successfully complete Attack Runs to earn Target Points. Each player has a defense value they use to deflect Imperial attacks on their path to the Exhaust Port. They can even call on Obi-Wan Kenobi for help. Players who have earned four or more Target Points from previous Attack Runs can finally take aim and try to destroy the Death Star. The first player to do this is the winner!

—description from the publisher

After millennia of sterility, life has sprung again on Rauha. As a venerable Shaman, one of its five worlds has been entrusted to you. Your powers are divine and allow you to shape the environment in order to turn this world into a cradle of life energy, keeper of serenity and harmony for the centuries to come.

Obtain the most victory points, represented as Life Energy, to win the game. You have 2 Ages to turn your world into an energetic core of Rauha. In Age 1, vegetation, terrain, and wildlife will appear. In Age 2, civilizations will thrive.

The game takes place over 4 rounds, each divided into 3 turns followed by a scoring phase. Each turn, you will follow 5 steps:
1. Simultaneously take all Biome cards from the satellite whose symbol matches the one beneath your Avatar on your Player board (moon or star). 
2. Choose one card to place on any square of your Player board or discard to the Black Hole.
3. Receive a Divine Entity if you create a row or column of matching symbols on your Player board.
4. Activate your Avatar, plus any Divine Entities in the same row or column as your Avatar.
5. Finally move your Avatar one notch clockwise along the edge of your Player board, changing the row or column that will be activated on the next turn.

During the Scoring Phase, you will activate all your Biomes with Spore tokens and any Divine Entities you may have, gaining crystals and points as shown on the components.

-description from publisher

EL Oso is a one-player board game. You need 24 checkers (12 in each of two colors), five 6-sided dice, and a simple 5x5 game board.

The challenge of El Oso is to move your stacks of pieces across the board, without encountering the pieces of your opponent (“The Bear”). Your moves are completely under your control, but the Bear’s moves are random. Plan carefully and don’t expose yourself to too much risk, and you’ll get your team across the board.

A push your luck fruit bag builder of picking the fruit and then trying to sell as much as you can, but you can only sell what you can remember. Pick your fruit from the bag, stop at anytime, but don't pick out rotten fruit or your turn is over. Once 5 rotten fruit have been picked, the selling phase begins. Roll the dice and try and remember what fruit are in your bag. Once a player earns $10 they win!

SIX LINKS is a word guessing game. Be the first team to score 30 points by correctly guessing mystery words based on 6 clues! But… more clues mean less points!

Players form two even teams and play the game in rounds. In a given round, one player on each team will be the hinter, and the remaining players will be guessers. Each round, a new clue card (that contains 6 clues and a mystery word) is drawn by the designated hinter. The hinter has the power to choose if their team will play first or pass the clue card to the other team.

The hinter of the starting team randomly pulls tokens from the bag, dictating which clues can be given. Their team has ONE guess at the mystery word — if they guess wrong, the clue card is passed to the other team who can then pull more tokens from the bag and try to guess the word. The card is passed back and forth between teams until the mystery word is found!

Be strategic, and ready to show your acting, drawing, and singing skills!

In 1618, three men were tossed out of a window in Prague Castle in an act of protest against the catholic king of Bohemia, a defenestration beginning the Thirty Years’ War. Encompassing all of Germany and featuring soldiers and generals from all over Europe, the Thirty Years’ War was the last and greatest of the European Wars of Religion.

No Peace for Thirty Years is a two player stand alone game using the No Peace Without Spain system. It contains two scenarios, the Winter King scenario (from 1618 to 1629) and the Lion of the North scenario (from 1630 to 1648), as well as the full No Peace for Thirty Years scenario (from 1618 to 1648).

—description from the publisher

Chocolate, vanilla or berry frosting? Which one is the most delicious? And most importantly, which one will earn you victory?

Cupcake Draft is a fast-playing card drafting game, in which your goal is to bake different cupcakes for the picky customers.

Each game is divided into two phases - drafting and bidding.
 In the drafting phase players will draft different Cupcakes. Each of the cupcakes has different flavor levels which will help with certain customers.

In the bidding phase players use the Cupcakes which they drafted to bid for the customers which give victory points.

The player with the most victory points is the winner.

-description from publisher

More or Less is a trivia quiz card game, with an outlandish collection of random, surprising and amusing questions where you apply your judgement and answer with More or Less. Jam-packed with obscure trivia questions where you’ll likely answer based on your best judgement rather than knowledge. Unlike some other quiz and board games, More or Less a super-inclusive quiz game for all and means the brain of the group isn’t always going to win.

Fall of the Mountain King (Kickstarter Edition) is an EXCLUSIVE edition and will not be available at retail. It includes the following additional content and deluxe components:

- River of Fire Mini-Expansion
- Notorious Gnomes Mini-Expansion
- Copper-foiled box cover
- 125 Troll miniatures in 5 different player colours
- 25 Champion miniatures in 5 different player colours
- 30 Gnome miniatures
- 1 Swarm miniature
- Custom moulded GameTrayz inserts with individual player trays
- Warhammer miniature First Player marker
- 65 wooden Influence markers shaped like hands
- 5 wooden Supply barrels
- Shiny gold-foiled Elder cards
- Shiny silver-foiled Great Halls tokens
- Dual-layered Clan boards
- Custom wooden Gnome Wheel pawn with screen-printed "Evil eyes"
- Custom-printed wooden Troll Skull score markers
- 150 wooden custom-shaped Ancestry cubes

About the mini-expansions:

The River of Fire expansion is another Kickstarter exclusive.
"Desperate for a weapon to drive off the Gnomes, the Trolls have breached the volcanic crater at the mountain's heart, allowing burning lava to flow out.  As the game goes on, you'll try to divert the river of fire to overwhelm the Gnomes, confound your rivals, and draw strength from its intense power.  But be careful!  Too much heat can burn even the toughest Troll, and devastate unlucky Domains!"
- 22 Fireworker tokens
- 10 Volcano cards
- 25 Lava gems (acrylic)
- Rules booklet

Notorious Gnomes is another mini-expansion that comes with this edition.
"Each notorious gnome causes new headaches for you and offers big rewards for defeating them as well."
- 12 Notorious Gnome cards
- 8 Problem cards
- 12 Notorious Gnome tokens

There's festivity in the air! Ricky is also in the air, the 10-foot-tall donkey-shaped piñata that is the mascot and symbol of the town. The mayor has announced a contest to take down Ricky, and the whole town is invited to participate.

No one can break Ricky open by themselves, though, so you have to gather the best teammates from the four districts of town, each bringing their own abilities to the challenge. Snatch the right people from the hands of your competitors and gather the best team of piñata-poppers — but you never know who could be on the other teams until it's too late. Hurry up and pop Ricky before anyone else can, and you'll win all the candy inside, the Big Trophy, and never-ending prestige!

Blind Business is made up of a deck of 50 cards that are numbered from 1 to 11 in four colors, along with six jokers. You start with four cards in hand; after seeing them, shuffle them and place them so that all other players can see them, but not you.

On a turn, the active player requests a card from an opponent. If the opponent refuses to hand it over, they keep in their area for scoring at game's end; if they do hand it over, they can try to claim a card from the active player's hand — and the active player can then agree to this trade (with players swapping cards and scoring them) or refuse (with each scoring their own card). Whatever happens, players refill their hands to four cards.

Each player arranges cards in columns according to their color, with colors corresponding to the four zones in which the city is divided: the playground, the boardwalk, the central station, and downtown. At the end of the game, depending on the majorities, players earn points based on their card combinations. You can also win instantly by collecting five consecutive cards of a single color.

-description from publisher

The first of its kind - a squishy dice throwing and rolling strategy party game!

Asteroid Dice came about from a love of dice and dodgeball! A dicey combination? We don’t think so. Simply throw and collide your squishy foam dice to roll the highest score each round and win all the cards in the asteroid field. You must choose a dice from the middle of the table, but if you pick the same as someone else, then battle it out dodge-ball style to see who gets to keep that dice and who loses their card!
 Place all the giant squishy dice in the center of the table and take your deck of cards. Secretly choose which dice card you want to play, and on the count of 3 reveal it to the other players. Grab the dice you chose and prepare to roll them! If anyone matches their cards, you brawl with the chosen dice.

The last player hit will gain their opponent’s cards and the losers have to choose from the leftover dice. Now everyone rolls their dice in turn - starting with the D20 and down to the D6 with the highest number winning. But watch out for the special cards! Losteroid cards are blackholes that will suck all the cards away in the round and reduce your score if you end up with one in your score pile. Play your "I Can’t Diecide" card if you’re not sure which dice to choose or as part of your dice game strategy.

The player  with the most points, wins.

Robots vs. Dinosaurs is a turn-based action card game where players must battle for their survival before a massive asteroid impacts the planet.

The Story: Millions of years ago...
A dinosaur shaman has discovered an incoming Asteroid that will create havoc when it impacts in 5-7 days. There is a sacred cave in the great valley that can protect them. If they can get there before the impact, they’ll survive. Meanwhile, having escaped their imploding home planet, a group of robots have landed on the planet to make a new home. The robots have built shield generators to protect themselves, but their site is right in front of the sacred cave.

In this game, robots are trying to keep their shield generators operational to win the game and dinosaurs are trying to destroy the shield generators to get to the sacred cave to win.  There is a deck of 7 day cards which act as a countdown clock for the game.  Each day is a round where all players get a turn.  The Asteroid day is the last day of the game and is shuffled in a way where you don’t know if the game will end on day 5, 6 or 7.

Players Divide into two teams: Robots and Dinosaurs.  Each team has a deck of fighters, bonus and robot equipment cards.  The speed of your fighters will determine the turn order of each day where players will battle each other's fighters and try to break or fix the shield generators.

-description from publisher

The base game is a book and set of punch-out tokens that combine with ANY miniatures or grid maps you have from ANY game.

The modular system is designed for cooperative play with a large group of friends while being both budget friendly and allowing one to use some favorite game pieces that were either in storage or just never meant for gaming.

For instance you can play with Warhammer 40k, Dungeons & Dragons, and Star Wars mini figs all in the same game on a Heroclix map. The combinations are endless and easily supported by an easy to use system.

The game even supports basic play without any miniatures or maps in your collection.

Players choose teams from various classes and play games in either a cooperative or head-to-head fashion. Players can choose; Deathmatch, Capture the Flag, Crusade, or Survival Mode.

In "Crusade" mode players occupy bases around a map over the course of several rounds. In Survival Mode players cooperatively fight against waves of AI generated and operated themed opponents such as zombies, or aliens, or the dreaded escaped zoo animals.

Bottom Line is this is a fun board game with endless replicability and options.

This game came with a TI-400 5-function calculator.

Setup: give each player a checkout counter (board) and $23. Each board has spaces for 4 servings each of Fruit & Vegetables, Bread & Cereal, and Dairy, and 2 spaces each for Meat and Bonus items. On turn, spin the spinner then draw a card from the food group matching the color spun and decide if you want to buy it. If you don’t buy it, return it to the bottom of the deck. If you buy it, draw a Pot Luck card and pay the price for the item as det by the item card and Pot Luck card then discard the Pot Luck card and place the item on its matching space on your checkout counter. If all such spaces are filled, you may place the card on a Bonus Item space or hold it to trade or sell. In lieu of drawing a card, you may use your turn to sell or trade a food card to another player for food or money. If a player makes an incorrect challenge, any other player may challenge them. The person who was wrong (the player or the challenger) must pay the bank the correct amount without receiving a card. Game ends when a player fills their checkout counter entirely. That player gets a 100-point bonus. Players then score 25 points for each item on their counter and 1 point for each penny not spent. High score wins. As a variant, deal each P a People card at the start of the game. Each card shows a calorie target. During scoring, subtract one point for each calorie above or below the target.

In Furrow Fields, 2-4 players take on the role of farmers competing to earn the most points and win the Harvest Festival’s Grand Champion title. Points are earned by successfully growing and harvesting crops from your field and completing as many villager commissions as you can before the festival begins at the end of the 14th round. Each round consists of a day phase and a night phase.

Each round a different player begins the day by choosing two seeds from a dwindling selection (and thereby limiting the options for others), harvesting grown crops from their field, and deciding whether to spend points on or use farm tools. Once done tending to their field, they then either turn in a completed commission, take on a new one (before another player takes it), or spend the rest of the day exploring the village. The next player then starts their day phase, until everyone has completed their day and night falls. At night, as crops grow closer to harvest, a variety of events may take place ranging from a visit by the hungry local wildlife to a useful item finding its way into a field.

-description from publisher

Prove that you are the most skilled mechanic in Turbo Town and repair broken vehicles before your opponents do!
Will you be the fastest mechanic?

In a hectic city with illegal racing and impatient drivers who want their vehicles fixed now, if you want to be the most famous mechanic in town, you must repair vehicles before your rivals, but choose your customers wisely!

In this fast-paced game, 2 to 6 players compete in quick, 30-minute games that can only be won by one player!

You will assign the dice you obtain to vehicles to repair them, taking into account the unique ability of your mechanic and that you can re-roll them up to 3 times.

When you complete your victory objective card, you will trigger the end of the game.

Each car gives you a number of points, but if you get sets by colour, you will also score points!

-description from designer

(Español)
Demuestra que eres el mecánico más habilidoso de todo Turbo Town y repara los vehículos averiados ¡antes que tus oponentes!

En una ciudad frenética con carreras ilegales y conductores impacientes que quieren su vehículo arreglado ¡ya!, si quieres ser el mecánico más famoso de la ciudad, deberás reparar los vehículos antes que tus rivales, pero, ¡elige bien los clientes!

En este trepidante juego compiten de 2 a 6 jugadores, en partidas rápidas, de unos 30 minutos de duración, que ¡sólo puede ganar uno!

Tendrás que asignar los dados que obtengas a vehículos para repararlos, teniendo en cuenta la habilidad única de tu mecánico y que puedes relanzarlos hasta 3 veces.

Cuando completes tu carta de objetivos de victoria, desencadenarás el final de la partida.

Cada coche te da un número de puntos, pero, si logras conjuntos por colores, ¡también puntuarás!

"Arkanolodzy" is a cooperative card game for 2-4 players.

This game uses 22 major arcana tarot cards.

Players take turns playing cards one at a time, aiming to play all the cards.

Each card has unique abilities which may sometimes help or interfere the players.

If all players successfully play all cards, all players win.

However, if any player is unable to play a card on their turn, all players immediately lose.

-description from designer

Welcome to SEEDS! Players take the role of rival Ohio farmers and compete to become the most prolific “seeder” in the midwest!
SEEDS is an exciting set collecting card game with a twist of “push your luck” and a unique scoring system. Players will plant seeds from their hands into fields accessible to all players in an attempt to harvest said fields at just the right moment. Wait too long and someone else might reap what you have sown. Harvest too soon and you will fall behind in points. When harvesting players add matching cards from their hand to the cards that were harvested and score points.(cards in hand x cards harvested = total points)

—description from the designer

The party game where legends are born. Glory Trials is a highly-interactive team-based card game where you will compete in group challenges and complete individual secret missions in order to be victorious! The Glory Trials are an assortment of mini-games that have each been designed to test your abilities in different and interesting ways.

Throughout the game, players will also collect Secret Cards. These cards are kept confidential until played, and will describe a secret objective or a hidden ability.

The game is incredibly easy to learn! To setup, the 3 Trials (Mind, Body, and Spirit) must be separated into individual decks and placed in front of all players. Players then sit in a circle where every second person is on the same team.

To begin play, teams alternate taking turns going around the circle. At the beginning of a players turn, they draw a card from any deck and follow its instructions. The first team to win 3 challenge cards from each of the Mind, Body, and Spirit Trials wins the game!

-description from publisher

Huck + Monster is a field-to-table Ultimate Pickup game that condenses the action and gameplay of Ultimate into a travel-sized, sideline-ready, turn-based gamekit.

Ideal for Ultimate players and enthusiasts of any skill level, the Huck + Monster gamekit includes everything new Coaches need to train their next Ultimate team dynasty.


Gameplay Overview:

Handler rolls for throw distance. Adjacent defense rolls to challenge throw, disc path, or catch. Offense only rolls again for continues, or challenge catches. Highest roll count wins the challenge, and controls the disc. Catch discs in the opponent’s endzone to score.

---

Game Steps:

1. Add 7 players to each line. Add the offensive disc to the last open defensive line space.
2. Defense rolls 3 to throw. Disc moves roll total.
3. Teams roll 3 to move. Offense moves first. 
4. Roll total may be split across players. Players and discs cannot move over occupied spaces.
5. Roll 3 to throw, or catch; 3 to mark, or block.
6. Roll 1 when continuing; 2 when intercepting.
7. Roll strategy dice once per throw.
8. Score by catching disc from the endzone.
9. Game plays to 7 points; win by two.


      Certain pickup kits may include spinning pins,  


which replace “roll” instructions above.

The famous black stories concept in board game format!

A murder has been committed! The players have to work together and cleverly combine and puzzle to solve the crimes. Unlike in other black stories, there is no game master: the game itself asks the questions. In typical black stories fashion, the players can only use "Yes" and "No" to answer the questions.

Are the players going to be skilled investigators and solve all the crimes?
